medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient was reportedly in her usual state of health until the day prior to admission, when family noted confusion and a 10 minute period of unresponsiveness, prompting EMS activation. Symptoms included gurgling respirations and right upper extremity myoclonic motions. Her rectal temperature was elevated at 102.7, which decreased with Tylenol. She also had right-sided neck pain for approximately 1 week and slight abdominal pain when lying on her side.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Atrial fibrillation, hypertension, dementia, ulcerative colitis (in remission, recently off Asacol), insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus, status post left total knee replacement, and status post bilateral ankle fractures with chronic bilateral edema.
